meta_description: The historic 1859 home of waterman Salem Avery is located on the shores of the West River in Shady Side, Maryland. We are home to music, art & community events,
hours_text:
[ ](https://captainaverymuseum.org/about-spark)

# Captain Avery Museum Visitor Guidelines

The following guidelines are set to ensure every visitor to Captain Avery Museum and its grounds has an enjoyable experience. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out through the contact form above or call us at 410-867-4486.

#### Communications Policy

By registering for an event, you agree to receive email and print correspondence from us regarding upcoming events, volunteer opportunities, and other museum related activity. You may unsubscribe at any time. Have a question? Give us a call at 410-867-4486 or email us at [programs@captainaverymuseum.org](mailto:programs@captainaverymuseum.org). 

#### Pet Policy

Well-behaved, leashed dogs and their responsible owners are welcome to enjoy our grounds. Only service animals are allowed inside our building. To know if your pet is allowed at an outdoor event, please call 410-867-4486. 

#### Privacy Policy

We collect only information that is required by law or is otherwise necessary to provide a high level of service efficiently and securely. Your personal information is never given or sold to third parties.

Captain Avery Museum events are photographed for use in promotional material. Inform a staff member if you do not wish to be photographed.

#### Refund Policy

Refunds for event registrations are only offered if an event is cancelled by Captain Avery Museum. Donations are non-refundable. Sales of books or artwork are non-ref...
